alert.note: Alert for Central Tularosa Basin; Otero Mesa; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Tularosa Basin; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 1:01PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Otero County through 130 PM MDT... At 100 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles west of Sunspot, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... White Sands National Monument, Alamogordo, Sunspot, Holloman Air Force Base, La Luz, Boles Acres and Oliver Lee State Park. This includes the following highways... Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 195 and 212. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 50 and 71. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH

area.areaDesc: Central Tularosa Basin; Otero Mesa; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Tularosa Basin; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
